Header: Australia announces extra $140 million aid package for drought-hit farmers
Content: Australia announced a $140.56 million aid package for drought-afflicted farmers as much of east coast suffers the worst dry spell in living memory. Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull announced the funding from a farm in the state of New South Wales which will give farmers in need lump sum payments and support mental health initiatives and community groups. The announcement brings the governmentâ€™s total drought relief package to $576 million. The state government of New South Wales has also provided more than A$1 billion in assistance for farmers.
